column3: 1. The candidate gave a great explanation of a project they've worked on in the past and illustrated the flow of processes well on the whiteboard.
column5: 2. The candidate handled the pointed questions well, demonstrating a clear competency in the subject area.
column7: 3. The candidate responded well to questions which challenged the existing scope or constraints of problems both in the Project Explanation and Pointed Questions phase.
column9: 4. The candidate showed a clear interest in the subject area with a history of independent projects to validate that interest.
column11: 5. The candidate demonstrated both desire and aptitude for working on challenging problems.
column13: 6. The candidate was enjoyable to interview with and would make a great fit within the ModalAI Engineering team.

column4: She showed enough depth for the level of using a technology for a small project, use of axios for AJAX calls, discussed using REST APIs at a very high level.
column6:
She didn't seem to know jQuery/Bootstrap which is pretty dang common.
She didn't know what server tech being used in C# (likely ASP MVC....).
column10: She worked on one outside project it seemed.
column14: In the short interview she got pretty comfortable after the first 10 minutes, she was easy to interact with for sure.
column16: Looking for someone to run with a tech stack and she seems like she'll need a bit too much direction, perhaps in the future but I think we can locate something better fit.

column4: white board wasn't fully asked for, candidate gave solid high level description
column6: Gave good answers but maybe didn't fully understand the questions
column8: Responded well to question re: choice not to use mongodb
column10: Clearly read up on the company and showed interest, fairly basic independent project but shows drive
column14: after nerves went down a bit she seemed more comfortable, one on one much more comfortable
column16: A weak yes because I think she has enough knowledge to make an impact on bunker-web dashboard creation but would likely take a lot of learning to make impacts elsewhere

column4: Thought she did a good job explaining her logic around how she made her meal planner
column6: Not super applicable as I don't feel like we asked enough direct questions unrelated to her project
column10: Only a few projects but both using web/JS stuff is perfect
column12: Neither agree nor disagree here, she seemed interested but not overly so
column14: Thought she was overall very nice and good to talk to
column16: Not an outstanding yes but thought she showed good competency and an interest in us and what we do. I think she could deliver some results on the ERP and Portal projects!
